channel.title: #182: Responsible product design with Trine Falbe
channel.description:
<iframe height="200px" width="100%" frameborder="no" scrolling="no" seamless src="https://player.simplecast.com/09a99aa7-22b2-4374-ba68-6a6f8203e0a9?dark=false"></iframe>
@peldi continues this mini-season as he chats with Trine Falbe, UX strategist & designer, on responsible product design.
Gamification, dark patterns, artificial "roadblocks", notifications frameworks that exist only to hook you into the product - why bootstrappers shouldn't mindlessly copy these techniques.
Show notes:
* [Trine's website](https://www.trinefalbe.com/) * Trine's ethical design scorecard is available for download on [https://ethicaldesignhandbook.com/ ](https://ethicaldesignhandbook.com/) * [Typeform’s terms of service](https://admin.typeform.com/to/dwk6gt/)
You can also [watch this episode on YouTube](https://youtu.be/GPSXMrajcw8).
[Listen, download, and subscribe to the podcast here](https://bootstrapped.fm/182-responsible-product-design-with-trine-falbe/).
